sentences.english: Some matchmaking services cater to blood type.
sentences.chinese: 有些婚介所还根据血型提供配对服务。

sentences.english: The blood group antigens in the spermatozoa are inherent, not from the seminal plasma.
sentences.chinese: 精子血型抗原为本身所固有，并非来源于精浆。

sentences.english: The causes of transfusion reaction was detected by antiglobulin test of Coombs.
sentences.chinese: 通过血型血清学检测来寻找输血反应原因。

sentences.english: From these sup positions D'Adamo then claimed that our blood type determines what food we should eat.
sentences.chinese: 根据这些假设阿达莫声称血型决定人该吃什么。

sentences.english: Write down your blood type in your Yellow Book.
sentences.chinese: 在你的黄皮书上写下你的血型。

sentences.english: Wu Min tested the blood on the sheets and the blood type of the dead.
sentences.chinese: 吴敏化验出床单上的血迹和死者的血型一样。

sentences.english: Lee Dong Gun was more serious when he said he did not want to judge a person solely by blood type.
sentences.chinese: 李东健严肃的说他不会以血型来判断一个人的个性。

sentences.english: Those with Kell positive blood can pass it down to future generations.
sentences.chinese: 血型是凯尔阳性的人会将此基因遗传给后代。

sentences.english: If you are a husband you have to do other ABO blood type antibody titer.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是O你老公是其他血型还要做ABO抗体效价。

sentences.english: If type-specific blood is not available, O-negative blood is considered as a substitute.
sentences.chinese: 如果患者所需的血型缺乏，也可以用O型血代替。

sentences.english: Because doctors are aware of blood types, they can save lives by transfusing blood into patients.
sentences.chinese: 医生知道血型才能向患者输血挽救生命。

sentences.english: The Bombay phenotype proves that there's no immediate life-or-death advantage to having ABO blood types.
sentences.chinese: 孟买血型证实了ABO血型无需立即面对生死的优势。

sentences.english: The Bombay phenotype proves that there's no immediate life-or-death advantage to having ABO blood types.
sentences.chinese: 孟买血型证实了ABO血型无需立即面对生死的优势。

sentences.english: Traces of blood on the knife matched the suspects blood-type.
sentences.chinese: 刀刃上面的血迹与嫌疑犯的血型基本是一致的。

sentences.english: Type A's are the most artistic of the blood groups.
sentences.chinese: 型血是最具艺术细胞的血型。

sentences.english: He had skipped class the day we'd done blood typing.
sentences.chinese: 我们检测血型那天他翘课了。

definition: hemolysis (breakdown of red blood cells leading to anemia)
hemolytic disease of newborn (breakdown of red blood cells due to alloimmune reaction between mother and fetus)
to do a blood test/to have one's blood tested
hematin (blood pigment)/heme/hemoglobin/also written 血紅蛋白|血红蛋白
to check for compatibility (for an organ transplant)
heredity/to inherit (a trait)/to pass on (to one's offspring)
